required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment Patterns And Outcomes In Patients Treated With Benefix Or Refacto/Refacto AF - A Swedish Cohort Study
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment Patterns And Outcomes In Patients Treated With Benefix Or Refacto/Refacto Af - A Swedish Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: The overall aim of the study is to describe demographic and clinical characteristics, treatment patterns and outcomes, in the populations of hemophilia patients treated with BeneFIX and ReFacto/ReFacto AF in Sweden

detailed_description.textblock:
The overall aim of the study is to describe demographic and clinical characteristics, treatment patterns and outcomes, as well as the related direct treatment costs in the populations of hemophilia patients treated with BeneFIX and ReFacto/ReFacto AF, and in subgroups (e.g. level of severity) at the MHC in Sweden.
The study population will consist of all patients diagnosed with haemophilia (D66.9 (haemophilia A) D67.9 (haemophilia B) in International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems (ICD-10) that have been registered in the MHR since 1977 and that have had at least one registered prescription of BeneFIX or ReFacto/ReFacto AF in the MHR since market authorization of the respective product (Benefix August 27 1997, ReFacto April 13 1999, ReFacto AF July 1 2009). Diseased individuals are included. Information on drugs picked up at the pharmacy is available in the Prescribed Drug Register from 2005.

primary_outcome.measure: Year of birth for patients with Haemophilia A or B
primary_outcome.description: Year of birth for patients registered in the Malmö Haemophilia Register since 1977 and treated with Benefix or Refacto since MAA of the respective drug (Benefix August 27 1997, ReFacto April 13 1999). Measured at the first registered observation in the MHR.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of children, adolescents and adults with Haemophilia A or B
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of children, adolescents and adults in the cohort, i.e patients diagnosed with haemophilia A or B and treated with either Benefix or Refacto since MAA for the respective product and as registered in the Malmö Haemophilia Register (MHR). Observed at the last registered observation in the MHR, i.e. between 1977 and 2015.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of men and women with Haemophilia A or B
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of men and women in the cohort, i.e patients diagnosed with haemophilia A or B and treated with either Benefix or Refacto since MAA for the respective product and as registered in the Malmö Haemophilia Register (MHR).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of diseased patients diagnosed with Haemophilia A or B
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of diseased patients in the cohort, i.e patients diagnosed with haemophilia A or B and treated with either Benefix or Refacto since MAA for the respective product and as registered in the Malmö Haemophilia Register (MHR). Observed at study start.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects diagnosed with Haemophilia A
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients diagnosed with Haemophilia A in the cohort, i.e patients diagnosed with haemophilia A or B and treated with either Benefix or Refacto since MAA for the respective product and as registered in the Malmö Haemophilia Register (MHR) since the start of the register in 1977.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects diagnosed with Haemophilia B
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients diagnosed with Haemophilia A in the cohort, i.e patients diagnosed with haemophilia A or B and treated with either Benefix or Refacto since MAA for the respective product and as registered in the Malmö Haemophilia Register (MHR) since the start of the register in 1977.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with severe, moderate and mild Haemophilia A or B
Age at diagnosis for Haemophilia A or B
primary_outcome.description: To identify the age at diagnosis for the patients in the cohort, i.e patients diagnosed with haemophilia A or B and treated with either Benefix or Refacto since MAA for the respective product and as registered in the Malmö Haemophilia Register (MHR)

primary_outcome.measure: Age at start of replacement treatment for Haemophilia A or B
primary_outcome.description: To identify the age at start of treatment for the patients in the cohort, i.e patients diagnosed with haemophilia A or B and treated with either Benefix or Refacto since MAA for the respective product and as registered in the Malmö Haemophilia Register (MHR). Observed at study start.

primary_outcome.measure: Age at start of treatment with Benefix or Refacto for Haemophilia A or B
primary_outcome.description: To identify the age at start of treatment with Benefix/Refacto for the patients in the cohort, i.e patients diagnosed with haemophilia A or B and treated with either Benefix or Refacto since MAA for the respective product and as registered in the Malmö Haemophilia Register (MHR). Age as observed at the first treatment occasion with Benefix or Refacto, observed at study start.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with inhibitor status current development of inhibitors, ever, never for patients with Haemophilia A or B
Percentage of patients that has ever been infected with Hepatitis C for patients diagnosed with Haemophilia A or B
Percentage of Haemophilia A or B patients who have a positive HIV status
Average prescribed dose per infusion in international units for factor IIIV and factor IX concentrates
primary_outcome.description: Yearly averages will be presented by patient age.

primary_outcome.measure: Average prescribed dose per kilogram in international units for factor IIIV and factor IX concentrates
primary_outcome.description: Prescribed dose per infusion divided by body weight. Average annual values will be presented by patient age

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients on prophylactic treatment
Average prescribed dose per kilogram bodyweight in international units for factor IIIV and factor IX concentrates for patients on prophylaxis
primary_outcome.description: Prescribed dose per week divided by the registered body weight. Values will be presented by patient age.

primary_outcome.measure: Average prescribed frequency of infusion of factor IIIV and factor IX factor concentrates
primary_outcome.description: Average of one year

primary_outcome.measure: Average prescribed number of infusions of factor IIIV and factor IX concentrates per week for patients on prophylaxis
primary_outcome.description: Average of one year

primary_outcome.measure: Average prescribed annual dose of factor IIIV and IX concentrates
primary_outcome.description: Average of one year

primary_outcome.measure: Average prescribed annual dose of factor IIIV and IX concentrates per kilogram bodyweight for patients on prophylaxis
primary_outcome.description: Average of one year

primary_outcome.measure: Average annual registered consumption of factor IIIV and IX concentrates
primary_outcome.description: Average of one year

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with consumption of factor VIII concentrate
Number of patients with consumption of factor IX concentrate
Number of patients with consumption of factor rVIIa and/or aPCC concentrate
Percentage of time on Refacto or Benefix of total time on replacement treatment
Average use of factor concentrate at hospital for invasive procedures
primary_outcome.description: Average per event

primary_outcome.measure: Average annual use of factor concentrate at hospital for invasive procedures
primary_outcome.description: yearly averages

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of annual use of factor concentrate at hospital for invasive procedures of total use of factor concentrates
Average annual number of filled prescriptions of factor concentrate
Average annual number of dispensed units of factor concentrate
Percentage of units of Benefix or Refacto
Average number of bleed events
primary_outcome.description: yearly averages

primary_outcome.measure: Average number of traumatic joint bleed events
primary_outcome.description: yearly averages

primary_outcome.measure: Average number of spontaneous joint bleed events
primary_outcome.description: yearly averages

primary_outcome.measure: Average number of traumatic bleeds in soft tissue
primary_outcome.description: yearly averages

primary_outcome.measure: Average number of spontaneous bleeds in soft tissue
primary_outcome.description: yearly averages

primary_outcome.measure: Average number of intracranial bleeds
primary_outcome.description: yearly averages

primary_outcome.measure: Average number of gastrointestinal bleeds
primary_outcome.description: yearly averages

primary_outcome.measure: Average number of urinary tract bleeds
primary_outcome.description: yearly averages

primary_outcome.measure: Average value of Gilbert Joint Score
primary_outcome.description: Yearly averages from registration in the register MHR until 2008/2009

primary_outcome.measure: Average value of Haemophilia Joint Health Score
primary_outcome.description: yearly averages from when data is available, i.e., years 2008/2009

primary_outcome.measure: Total number of invasive procedures by type, calculated over all patients in the cohort
To identify the number of patients that have had 1, 2, 3 or more respectively joint surgeries
Average relative dose intensity of factor concentrate for patients on prophylaxis
primary_outcome.description: Based on patient registered volume of units of factor concentrate consumed. Annual registered consumption of factor concentrate per patient divided by annual prescribed dose per patient

primary_outcome.measure: Average relative dose intensity of factor concentrate dispensed for patients on prophylaxis
primary_outcome.description: Based on dispensed volume of units of factor concentrate from 2005 when the pharmaceutical register started . Annual dispensed volume of factor concentrate per patient divided by annual prescribed dose per patient.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average annual cost of prescribed factor concentrate
secondary_outcome.description: yearly averages. Costs will be based on registered retail prices (AUP) and corrected for inflation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average annual cost of dispensed factor concentrate
secondary_outcome.description: Average annual values based on calendar year, from July 2005 until last dispense registered in the pharmaceutical register

secondary_outcome.measure: Average cost of replacement treatment related to bleed event
Average annual cost of replacement treatment for bleed events as registered in the MHR
Cost for bleed events registered in the MHR as percentage of total annual cost of replacement treatment
Average cost of replacement treatment related to joint surgery as registered in the MHR
Average annual cost of replacement treatment related to joint surgery
Cost for replacement treatment related to joint surgery registered in the MHR as percentage of total annual cost of replacement treatment
Average cost of replacement treatment related to invasive procedures as registered in the MHR
Average annual cost of replacement treatment related to invasive procedures
Cost for replacement treatment related to invasive procedures registered in the MHR as percentage of total annual cost of replacement treatment

arm_group.description: Patients in The MHR diagnosed with Haemophilia A
Patients in The MHR diagnosed with Haemophilia B

study_pop.textblock: The study population will consist of all patients diagnosed with hemophilia (D66.9 (hemophilia A) D67.9 (hemophilia B) in International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems (ICD-10) that have been registered in the Malmö Hemophilia Register since 1977 and that have had at least one registered prescription of BeneFIX or ReFacto/ReFacto AF in the MHR since market authorization of the respective product (Benefix August 27 1997, ReFacto April 13 1999, ReFacto AF July 1 2009). Diseased individuals are included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The study population will consist of all patients diagnosed with hemophilia (D66.9 (hemophilia A) D67.9 (hemophilia B) in International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems (ICD-10) that have been registered in the Malmö Hemophilia Register since 1977 and that have had at least one registered prescription of BeneFIX or ReFacto/ReFacto AF in the MHR since market authorization of the respective product
Exclusion Criteria:
- No exclusion criteria in this study
